java/liquibase/change/RenameColumnChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.SQLiteDatabase;
00005 import liquibase.database.SQLiteDatabase.AlterTableVisitor;
00006 import liquibase.database.sql.RenameColumnStatement;
00007 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00008 import liquibase.database.structure.Column;
00009 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00010 import liquibase.database.structure.Index;
00011 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00012 import liquibase.exception.JDBCException;
00013 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00014 import liquibase.exception.InvalidChangeDefinitionException;
00015 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00016 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00017 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00018 
00019 import java.util.ArrayList;
00020 import java.util.Arrays;
00021 import java.util.HashSet;
00022 import java.util.List;
00023 import java.util.Set;
00024 
00028 public class RenameColumnChange extends AbstractChange {
00029 
00030     private String schemaName;
00031     private String tableName;
00032     private String oldColumnName;
00033     private String newColumnName;
00034     private String columnDataType;
00035 
00036     public RenameColumnChange() {
00037         super("renameColumn", "Rename Column");
00038     }
00039 
00040 
00041     public String getSchemaName() {
00042         return schemaName;
00043     }
00044 
00045     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00046         this.schemaName = StringUtils.trimToNull(schemaName);
00047     }
00048 
00049     public String getTableName() {
00050         return tableName;
00051     }
00052 
00053     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00054         this.tableName = tableName;
00055     }
00056 
00057     public String getOldColumnName() {
00058         return oldColumnName;
00059     }
00060 
00061     public void setOldColumnName(String oldColumnName) {
00062         this.oldColumnName = oldColumnName;
00063     }
00064 
00065     public String getNewColumnName() {
00066         return newColumnName;
00067     }
00068 
00069     public void setNewColumnName(String newColumnName) {
00070         this.newColumnName = newColumnName;
00071     }
00072 
00073     public String getColumnDataType() {
00074         return columnDataType;
00075     }
00076 
00077     public void setColumnDataType(String columnDataType) {
00078         this.columnDataType = columnDataType;
00079     }
00080 
00081     public void validate(Database database) throws InvalidChangeDefinitionException {
00082         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(tableName) == null) {
00083             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("tableName is required", this);
00084         }
00085         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(oldColumnName) == null) {
00086             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("oldColumnName is required", this);
00087         }
00088         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(newColumnName) == null) {
00089             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("newColumnName is required", this);
00090         }
00091 
00092     }
00093 
00094     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00095         if (database instanceof SQLiteDatabase) {
00096                 // return special statements for SQLite databases
00097                 return generateStatementsForSQLiteDatabase(database);
00098         } 
00099 
00100         return new SqlStatement[] { new RenameColumnStatement(
00101                         getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName(), 
00102                         getTableName(), getOldColumnName(), getNewColumnName(), 
00103                         getColumnDataType())
00104         };
00105     }
00106     
00107     private SqlStatement[] generateStatementsForSQLiteDatabase(Database database) 
00108                 throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00109         
00110         // SQLite does not support this ALTER TABLE operation until now.
00111                 // For more information see: http://www.sqlite.org/omitted.html.
00112                 // This is a small work around...
00113     
00114         List<SqlStatement> statements = new ArrayList<SqlStatement>();
00115         
00116         // define alter table logic
00117                 AlterTableVisitor rename_alter_visitor = 
00118                 new AlterTableVisitor() {
00119                         public ColumnConfig[] getColumnsToAdd() {
00120                                 return new ColumnConfig[0];
00121                         }
00122                         public boolean copyThisColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00123                                 return true;
00124                         }
00125                         public boolean createThisColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00126                                 if (column.getName().equals(getOldColumnName())) {
00127                                         column.setName(getNewColumnName());
00128                                 }
00129                                 return true;
00130                         }
00131                         public boolean createThisIndex(Index index) {
00132                                 if (index.getColumns().contains(getOldColumnName())) {
00133                                         index.getColumns().remove(getOldColumnName());
00134                                         index.getColumns().add(getNewColumnName());
00135                                 }
00136                                 return true;
00137                         }
00138                 };
00139                 
00140         try {
00141                 // alter table
00142                         statements.addAll(SQLiteDatabase.getAlterTableStatements(
00143                                         rename_alter_visitor,
00144                                         database,getSchemaName(),getTableName()));
00145                 } catch (JDBCException e) {
00146                         System.err.println(e);
00147                         e.printStackTrace();
00148                 }
00149         
00150         return statements.toArray(new SqlStatement[statements.size()]);
00151     }
00152 
00153     protected Change[] createInverses() {
00154         RenameColumnChange inverse = new RenameColumnChange();
00155         inverse.setSchemaName(getSchemaName());
00156         inverse.setTableName(getTableName());
00157         inverse.setOldColumnName(getNewColumnName());
00158         inverse.setNewColumnName(getOldColumnName());
00159         inverse.setColumnDataType(getColumnDataType());
00160 
00161         return new Change[]{
00162                 inverse
00163         };
00164     }
00165 
00166     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00167         return "Column "+tableName+"."+ oldColumnName + " renamed to " + newColumnName;
00168     }
00169 
00170     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00171         Element node = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement("renameColumn");
00172         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00173             node.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00174         }
00175         
00176         node.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00177         node.setAttribute("oldColumnName", getOldColumnName());
00178         node.setAttribute("newColumnName", getNewColumnName());
00179 
00180         return node;
00181     }
00182 
00183     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00184 
00185         Table table = new Table(getTableName());
00186 
00187         Column oldColumn = new Column();
00188         oldColumn.setTable(table);
00189         oldColumn.setName(getOldColumnName());
00190 
00191         Column newColumn = new Column();
00192         newColumn.setTable(table);
00193         newColumn.setName(getNewColumnName());
00194 
00195         return new HashSet<DatabaseObject>(Arrays.asList(table, oldColumn, newColumn));
00196 
00197     }
00198 
00199 }
